title: L&T carves out separate vertical for Renewable EPC out of transmission & distribution business
description: A. Ravindran, Senior Vice President – Larsen & Toubro, has been appointed as the Head of Renewable Business.Larsen and ToubroRelated stories
content: Larsen & Toubro has carved out a separate business vertical for renewable EPC out of its power transmission and distribution business within its infrastructure projects segment with effect from September 1. Senior Vice-President A Ravindran will lead the renewable business. L&T Chairman and Managing Director SN Subrahmanyan said that the growth of renewable EPC business has accelerated in recent years. "Thanks to our early start and investments, we have built an organisation that is uniquely placed in the value chain of creating sustainable energy infrastructure. This space is promising. Multiple opportunities are visible. We want to capitalise on our success and wish to remain a preferred partner of choice for our customers. Creation of this vertical will give increased autonomy, customer proximity and leadership oversight to the business and enable us to excel in this space." Also Read | L&T eyes green energy, plans to leverage technology and sustainability to create new opportunities L&T's iconic renewable energy projects in India include the 90MW Omkareshwar Floating Solar project commissioned recently, first grid scale solar-cum-storage project, implementation of decentralised distributed generation packages for remote villages and more. L&T green power projects in Middle East L&T is associated with some of the world’s  single-site renewable energy parks. InSaudi Arabia, L&T is a key player involved in major projects, including the 700 MW Ar RassSolar PV IPP, the 2,000 MW Ar Rass-2 Solar PV IPP, and the 1.6 GW Sudair solar plant. On July 8, it announced orders for two more plants with an aggregate capacity of 3.5GWac. Additionally, L&T is advancing renewable infrastructure with a 250 MWp solar PVplant in the Amaala Project and has completed a large-scale solar installation in Jeddah. L&T posted a 12 percent surge in net profit in the first quarter of FY25, slightly below estimates, as the company's revenue from operations rose 15 percent in the April-June quarter. After the announcement, shares of L&T were trading marginally down 0.40 percent at Rs 3689.95 apiece on September 2 at 12:13pm.
